posts.title: Clubhouse Culture
posts.content:
Sportswear and lifestyle brand Rapha is bringing its Clubhouse experience to Bentonville starting Oct. 1. 

  • Looking forward: Rapha has a packed schedule of events like meet and greet evenings with renowned cyclists, watch parties, after-race after parties, and more. The pop-up Clubhouse will be in the old City Hall at 117 West Central in Bentonville.
  • Gear up: You'll have opportunity to locally shop the current collection of Performance Trailwear to prepare yourself for weekly group rides and weekend adventures all guided by members of the Rapha team.

For details and updates, click HERE.

posts.title: The More You Know
posts.content:
You might ride a bike every day, but do you know how it works, and the history of its evolution?

  • The latest: The Amazeum is always amazing us with its new fun and science-y exhibits. Developed by the Carnegie Science Center in Pittsburgh, GEAR UP: The Science of Bikes is coming to Bentonville Sept. 24 through Jan. 10. 
  • A deeper look: The exhibit will walk attendees through the “science, technology, engineering, art and math in the world’s most recognizable mode of transportation.” 

Reserve tickets HERE.

posts.title: Gathering on the Green
posts.content:
The NWA Championship is so much more than a golf tournament. It’s an opportunity for the community to be a part of a wide variety of family friendly events! 

  • What's happening: During the week there will be yoga events for kids and adults, LPGA Tour Professional Maria Fassi will hold a junior golf clinic, and a 5k @ the LPGA will take place to benefit Mercy. You can download the ‘NWAChampionship’ app for daily schedules and updates. 
  • For the food: There is also opportunity to have the BITE Experience with access to exclusive viewing locations on the course with local food and beverage samplings. Registration is open and tickets are available.

Learn more, and get involved HERE.

posts.title: Click Driven
posts.content:
What if you could order a car online, then have it delivered to you as soon as the next day? Well, it’s possible now in Northwest Arkansas, because Carvana has come to town. 

  • Driven to you: The leading e-commerce platform has expanded into the fourth Arkansas market, delivering to “Fayetteville area residents.” Now you can shop an inventory of more than 45,000 used cars and have a touchless home delivery. 
  • Faster, cheaper: The business offers auto financing, access to a car loan calculator, and just plain savings on time and money when it comes to car shopping. 

Read more HERE.

posts.title: Around a Fire Again
posts.content:
We know most of you are just waiting for those fall days to arrive. For those of you hanging on to the last weeks of summer, we're happy for you.

  • Regardless: October's coming and festivities are coming with it. Downtown Springdale will be celebrating hard all month long with Ozarktober.
  • Ozark style: With live music events and local brewed drinks every Thursday and a bonfire event on Oct. 15, you can't go wrong. DJ Susie Q will be providing jams for the Fall Bonfire, and showing up again alongside with other artists. So stay tuned.

Click HERE for more details.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Eat, drink, sing: Thursdays are Family Pizzaroke Night at Big Box Karaoke and you can have 2 hours of karaoke, 1 pizza, and sodas for $40!*
  • Another level: Friday and Sunday tickets are available for the culinary experience at the NWA Championship with BITE NWA.*
  • Take a walk: Here's a list with 10 gorgeous hikes in NWA with great fall views.
  • Take it to-go: Local Lime wants to help provide for your next house party with take-home margaritas.
  • I see now: Well that's a fun fact, Eureka Springs.
  • Gather: The Walton Family Foundation compiled a list of some of NWA's inclusive, shared spaces and events.
  • Partner with us: We want to feature your business on our newsletter! Check out the advertising options on our website.

*Content is sponsored
